ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Failed to build heritrix in both jdk 1.6 and 1.5
ygData.msgSnippet: For the CachedBdbMapTest issue, you should look in the other build/test logs to see exactly which test failed. One of the CachedBdbMapTest tests in particular,
ygData.rawEmail:

From: Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...>
Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Failed to build heritrix in both jdk 1.6 and
 1.5
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=Kvl7CGviFXUtIyU6Jjov-voE-sn6FgTGMsneKup4Lg7x
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

For the CachedBdbMapTest issue, you should look in the other build/test 
logs to see exactly which test failed. One of the CachedBdbMapTest tests 
in particular, testMemMapCleared, is dependent on timing/GC issues that 
can vary between machines and JVMs. If that's the only test failing, I 
would suggest either tinkering with its sleep times to get success in 
your local environment, or disabling that test entirely.

I would not suggest going back to a 1.5-based JVM if you have a choice. 
(The error you're seeing there is because 1.5-based compilers object to 
@Override marking methods than implement interfaces, while that's OK 
with 1.6-based compilers, even if creating 1.5-compatible code as our 
maven build intends.)

- Gordon @ IA

On 12/6/10 3:05 AM, Xi Liu wrote:
>
>
> Hi all
> I got some problem with building heritrix. I will try not to miss
> something about the whole process but if I do please let me know.
> my machine is running debian testing, 2.6.32-5-amd64, the heritrix I use
> is heritrix-1.14.4-src.tar.gz downloaded from sourceforge, and build it
> using maven 1.0.2, all as the manual said.
>
>
> *first I built it under java version "1.6.0_22" *
> *the unit test org.archive.util.CachedBdbMapTest FAILED*
